abstract: Searches the children of the receiving node to perform processing for nodes that share a name.

declaration.code: @MainActor func enumerateChildNodes(withName name: String, using block: @escaping (SKNode, UnsafeMutablePointer<ObjCBool>) -> Void)

overview:
## Discussion

This method enumerates the child array in order, searching for nodes whose names match the search parameter. The block is called once for each node that matches the name parameter.

The following Swift code shows how you could enumerate through the child nodes of a scene with a name containing the string `yellow`. Each matching node is hidden until the enumeration finds a node that also contains the string `triangle`. When this node is reached, `stop` is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] and the processing stops.

Listing 1. Enumerating child nodes

You can also search by class name using [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/enumerateChildNodes(withName:using:)]. However, for custom classes, you need to specify the fully annotated class name (i.e. the project name followed by the class name). The following Swift code shows a custom class, `SpaceshipNode`, based on [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKSpriteNode], and created in a project named `SpaceGame`. The first search fails to return an instance of  `SpaceshipNode` added as a child of `parentNode`:

Listing 2. Enumerating child nodes

items.description: Access nodes by name to avoid needing an instance variable.
items.name: Searching the Node Tree

items.description: Searches the children of the receiving node for a node with a specific name.
items.name: childNode(withName:)

items.description: Returns an array of nodes that match the name parameter.
